description.narrative: Supporting Community Resilience through followings: a) Reducing losses from disasters (DRR) b) improving response to disasters (DM) c) strengthening the learning base on DRR and DM

UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Disaster Risk Reduction in PAK Phase 1 (2016-2018) Indicators: 1.1: Extent to which support mechanism are effectively operationalized in order to strengthen institutional system of DRR at national and sub national level 1 = Not at all 2 = to a very partial extent 3=to some extent 4= to a significant extent 5=to full extent 1.2: National strategy on Sendai Framework for action prepared and operationalized 1.3: DRR Stakeholder’s coordination on information management mechanism established 1.4: Private sector partnership strategy on Disaster Risk Reduction developed 1.5: DRR plans for mainstreaming DRR in priority sectors 2.1: Number of DRR mitigation schemes implemented in partnership with private sector
Disaster Risk Reduction in PAK Phase II (2019-2020) Indicators: 1.1 Number of annual review of DRR and CCA plans conducted 1.2 Number of district DRM & CCA plans improved or developed 1.3 Number of district emergency operation centers strengthened 2.1 Number of progress reviews conducted for gauging progress on DRR related frameworks 2.2 Number of reviews conducted for creating synergies among DRR national Policies and plans 2.3 Number of events organized to create and strengthen networks and alliances for implementing SFDRR 2.4 Number of provincial hackathon events on public private partnership organized 2.5 Number of DRR and CCA trainings conducted 2.6 Number of trainings organized for district officials on ERNA guidelines 2.7: Number of transitional shelters and street pavements 3.1: Number of consultation sessions on aligning national DRR policies and plans with international frameworks 3.2: Number of National Action Plans reviewed and launched 3.3: Number of ERNA capacity enhancement sessions organized 3.4: Number of online DRR courses developed and launched 3.5: Number of campaigns designed and launched on DRR (including pandemics) 4.1: Number of government buildings and selected public sites disinfected 4.2: Number of solutions from hackathons implemented

comment.narrative: Disaster Risk Reduction in PAK Phase 1 ( 2016-2018) Baseline: 1.1: 1(N/A) 1.2: 1(Currently the strategy doesn’t exist) 1.3: 1 (Weak information management mechanism) 1.4: 0 1.5: 0 2.1: 0 Disaster Risk Reduction in PAK Phase II (2019-2020) Baseline: 1.1: 0 1.2: 0 1.3: 0 2.1: 0 2.2: 0 2.3: 0 2.4:0 2.5: 0 2.6: 0 2.7: 0 3.1: 0 3.2: 0 3.3: 04 3.4: 0 3.5: 0 4.1: 0 4.2: 0 4.3: 2 (Very partially) 4.4: Scale 3 4.5: 0

1.1: 4 [Annual reviews have taken place in Kashmore, Ghotki, Rajanpur, and Muzaffargarh]. 1.2: 5 plans (Tharparkar, Dadu, Jhang, Chitral, Dera Ismail Khan) 1.3: 5 [DEOCs strengthened (Tharparkar, Dadu, Jhang, Chitral, Dera Ismail Khan)] 2.1: 1 [1 review conducted] 2.2: 4 [annual progress review events carried out] 2.3: 1[Thematic Group organized] 2.4: 15 [3 hackathons organized (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Sindh, and Punjab), 3 working groups developed (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Sindh, and Punjab and 9 model PWD and women friendly DRR schemes implemented in districts] 2.5: 3 [provincial trainings conducted (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Sindh, and Punjab)] 2.6: 9 [trainings on ERNA guidelines] 2.7: 10 [family transitional shelters provided] 3.1: 02 [ Number of consultation sessions on aligning national DRR policies and plans with international frameworks] 3.2: 01 [Number of National Action Plans reviewed and launched] 3.3: 02 [Number of ERNA capacity enhancement sessions organized] 3.4: 02 [Number of online DRR courses developed and launched] 3.5: No Target Planned for 2020 4.1: 30 [Number of government buildings and selected public sites disinfected] 4.2: 05 [Number of solutions from hackathons implemented] 4.3: Scale 3 [Extent of coordination support provided to NEOC] 4.4: No Target Planned for 2020 4.5: No Target Planned for 2020
